Name: Sacrificial Shrine
Description: Gain 2 $F whenever own creature is killed
Lore: The fires are bright and full of screams.

Name: Cerberus
Lore: What is more than 1 head? Two heads!; What is more than 2 heads? Three heads!

Name: Harpy
Lore: I smell magic in the air.; Or maybe barbecue.

Name: Imp
Lore: Caring for the fires is my pleasure.

Name: Succubus
Description: Combat: target enemy creature; That creature does not participate in this combat; The Succubus's attributes are ignored in combat
Lore: Pleasure beyond life.

Name: The Balrog
Description: +1 \M for every $F you own; Produces 1 $F every turn
Lore: Dark fire avails him, the flame of Udun, servant of shadows.

Name: The Mephisto
Description: Grants -1 \F to all creatures, own and enemy
Lore: All worlds will fall before the burning standards of Hell. I have seen it.

Name: Desecrated Urn
Description: Give to own or enemy creature

Name: Embers
Lore: Made in the hell, burns forever.

Name: Fel Magic
Description: At the end: kill the creature holding Fel Magic
Lore: It promises great power, but it exacts a terrible price.

Name: Incantation Scroll
Description: Destroy the Incantation Scroll to cast a spell for free; Keep the spell card
Lore: Malla, Eer, Dul, Aman, Shala, Ros, Ackra, Sheer, Thalla, Salthrak, Imar, Kalador, An’perath, O’sakana, Ferik, ...

Name: Break
Lore: Your staff is broken.

Name: Curse
Description: Combat: grant -1 \M to all enemy creatures
Lore: Death is the only way to lift the curse.

Name: Illusion
Description: Target own creature; Create temporary creature with same tags and attributes as printed on the target; Temporary creature is removed at the end of the turn

Name: Kamikaze
Description: Sacrifice (kill) own demonic creature; Kill enemy creature with positive faith

Name: Transfiguration
Description: Rearrange resource tokens between all your cards that can store them; Changing type of tokens is allowed
Lore: Turning water into wine is faith.; Turning copper into gold is alchemy.

Name: Unholly Smite
Description: Combat: all creatures (own and enemy) with negative \F gain +1 \M, with positive \F gain -1 \M

Name: Upside Down
Lore: Alternate dimension that mirrors our world.

Name: Angel
Description: Grants +1 \F to all divine creatures, own and enemy
Lore: I saw the angel in the marble and carved until I set her free.

Name: Griffin
Lore: Stand straight, walk proud, have a little faith.

Name: Oracle
Lore: You've already made the choice. You're here to understand why you've made it.

Name: Phoenix
Description: Gain 2 $F tokens when resurrected; Once per turn: resurrect if dead

Name: Titan
Lore: In the name of god, we fight.

Name: Wizard
Description: All spells cost 1 $M less (this effect does not stack)
Lore: You shall not pass!

Name: The God
Lore: The faith is absolute.

Name: Holy Water
Description: +2 \M if enemy has any undead creature
Lore: Tastes like tap water.

Name: Blessing
Description: Defending: grant +1 \M to all own creatures

Name: Counterspell
Description: Play immediately after enemy spell to cancel it; Cannot cancel Counterspell

Name: Lightning Bolt
Lore: Death as fast as light.

Name: Omniscience
Description: Enemy player reveals their hand for 10 seconds.

Name: Resurrect
Description: Resurrect one own dead non-undead non-demonic creature

Name: Dwarf Fortress
Lore: Booze does all the work in forts.; Dwarves are just booze exoskeletons.

Name: Vault
Description: Draw 2 cards; Once per turn: spend 1 $G to draw 3 cards
Lore: Gems and money is what makes a dwarf happy.

Name: The Guild
Description: At the end: gain +X to one of \M/\C/\F, where X is number of own $G
Lore: Money buys you anything.

Name: Axedwarf
Lore: I’m wasted on cross-country. We dwarves are natural sprinters. Very dangerous over short distances.

Name: Blacksmith
Description: All items cost 1 $G less (this effect does not stack)
Lore: Tailor for the wealthy.; I mean... for the dwarfs.; ...; For wealthy dwarfs.

Name: Miner
Lore: The spirits of the earth guide me.; You mean metal ores.; Of course.

Name: Runesmith
Description: Item is destroyed (own or enemy): spend 1 $G and give that item to own creature for free

Name: Talos Automaton
Lore: Talos is the Sun.

Name: Booze
Description: +1 \M, +2 \C if held by dwarf or human

Name: Jewel
Lore: Antique ruby pendant with perfect diamond cut, flawless clarity and deep red color, 3 carats.

Name: Dwarf Race
Lore: Dwarves delved too greedily and too deep.

Name: Sacred Grove
Description: Grants +1 \M or +1 \C, whichever printed value is larger, to all own elf creatures
Lore: Greatest civilizations are grown from the ashes of their foes.

Name: Centaur
Lore: How do you wear pants?; I dont.

Name: Druid
Lore: One tree, two trees, tree threes, ... three trees, ... I have to stop playing the dies, ... the dices ...

Name: Ent
Lore: You see, we lost the entwives.

Name: Entwife
Lore: I am right here, you dumb***.

Name: Faerie
Lore: The fairest of them all.

Name: Wisp
Lore: Eo, eo, eo.

Name: Book of Laments
Lore: Massë ná romba i súyanë? Avániër vë mistë orossë, vë súlimë lairenna. Var cenuva yéni sirala et Ëarello entula?

Name: Invisibility Cloak
Description: Prevents its wearer from being targeted by enemy spells
Lore: No peeping!

Name: Lembas
Lore: One small bite is enough to fill the stomach of a grown man.

Name: Leprechaun Pendant
Lore: Humans believe in luck and in circumstances.; Elves believe in cause and effect.

Name: Mirror Fountain
Lore: The mirror shows many things.; Things that were. Things that are. And some things that have not yet come to pass.

Name: Elf Race
Lore: Elves shall be the fairest of all earthly creatures, and they shall have and shall conceive and bring forth more beauty than all others, and they shall have the greater bliss in this world.; Also pointy ears!

Name: Castle
Lore: Draw bridge, machicolations, murder holes, hoardings, arrowslits, bartizans, embrasures, merlons, ...

Name: Temple
Lore: In nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus sancti.

Name: Trebuchet
Lore: I'm TNT! I'm dynamite!

Name: Workshop
Lore: Look, I'm an engineer, my time is valuable.

Name: Craftsman
Lore: I'm being repressed!

Name: Knight
Lore: Damn helmet, can't seem to get this thing...

Name: Monk
Description: Attacking: the Monk uses \F instead of \M
Lore: Wololo.

Name: Peasant
Lore: Ready for work!; ...; Work, again?

Name: Priest
Lore: One ring to rule them all, one ring to find them. One ring to bring them all, ...; Sorry, wrong book.

Name: Thief
Description: Steal item from enemy creature and give it to the Thief

Name: The King
Description: Combat: grants +1 \M to all human creatures and buildings
Lore: The king commands, the nation obeys.

Name: The Tax Collector
Description: All creatures and buildings that produce resource tokens produce one additional token of same type

Name: Book of Poems
Lore: Time doesn’t heal wounds to make you forget.; Time leaves you with a scar to remind you of how you bled.

Name: Drama Mask
Lore: To be, or not to be, that is the question.

Name: Hookah
Lore: Eternal Smoke Dark Bean; Social Smoke Berry Punch; Starbuzz Blue Mist

Name: Lexico Innaturale
Description: +1 \C for each race present in the game (excluding spells), own or enemy
Lore: There are many different worlds in this universe. Some typical, others very strange and unnatural.

Name: Mandolin
Description: +2 \C if you have Book of Poems

Name: Mushroom Stew
Lore: Do you see the dragon?; No, but there is a unicorn staring at me.

Name: Sword
Lore: You have my sword.

Name: Doppelganger
Description: Play immediately after enemy spell that targets a creature; Choose another creature with same owner as replacement target for that spell

Name: Human Race
Lore: Mediocre in all respects.

Name: Maze
Lore: There is great treasue at the end. There is great minotaur in the way.

Name: Cyclop
Description: Win an attack: steal 1 random card from hand
Lore: King among blind.

Name: Dragon
Description: Kill one enemy creature or building; Produces 1 $F every turn
Lore: Look, I made an obsidian.

Name: Goblin
Lore: Judge me by my size, do you?

Name: Hydra
Description: Win a combat: grows additional head; +2 \M for each head

Name: Minotaur
Lore: I am not a cyclop. I have two eyes.

Name: Orc
Description: Once per turn: place additional Orc creature
Lore: What do you do with orcs?; More orcs!

Name: Troglodyte
Lore: Twolobite, ... trilobite, ... troglodyte!

Name: Troll
Lore: Left head: 'This way!'; Right head: 'No, that way!'

Name: Bone Dagger
Lore: Embrace the darkness within and make offerings in blood and flesh.

Name: Meat
Description: +2 \M if held by orc; +2 \C if held by non-orc
Lore: Looks like meat's back on the menu, boys.

Name: Poison
Lore: Coward's weapon.

Name: Orc Race
Lore: Brutish, aggressive, ugly, and malevolent race of monsters, descended from a corruption of elves.

Name: Graveyard
Description: Once per turn: spend 3 resource tokens of any kind to create a Skeleton
Lore: Humans check in. They don't check out.

Name: Tomb
Lore: Most people disdain gravedigging.; Undead call it recycling.

Name: Banshee
Description: Target enemy creature; Destroy up to 2 resource tokens on the target
Lore: Wails worse than your wife.; Unbeliavable, I know.

Name: Ghost
Lore: I'm invisible, gaseous, and deadly.

Name: Lich
Lore: I always wanted to start my own religion... so I did!

Name: Mummy
Lore: Just a glorified roll of toilet paper.

Name: Skeleton
Lore: No guts, no gory.

Name: Spectre
Description: At the end: target a creature, own or enemy; The spectre has same attributes as the printed attributes of the target

Name: Vampire
Description: Once per turn: spend 1 $M to steal a resource token of any kind from the enemy
Lore: I'm having a mid-death crisis.

Name: Plague
Description: Combat: all enemy non-undead creatures have -1 \M, +1 \F
Lore: You may pray, but without breath you cannot fight.

Name: Raise Undead
Description: Requires Graveyard: target dead non-undead creature, own or enemy, and remove it; Create a Zombie

Name: Will-o-the-wisp
Description: Combat: target enemy non-undead non-demonic creature; That creature does not participate in this combat

Name: Undead Race
Lore: Technically dead, but still animate.
